attributes.action: Start a new trading community to effectively compete with the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The European Free Trade Association currently consists of Norway, Switzerland, Iceland and Liechtenstein. The EFTA was established in 1960 as a a trade bloc alternative for countries who are either unable or unwilling to join the EU. 
Alternatively The UK could join the EFTA and build it into an organisation that effectively competes with the EU
attributes.background: According to the latest news reports, we as a country will be forced by the EU to accept free movement of EU citizens if we want to trade with the EU. The U.K. Government should consider the possibility of creating a new coalition of countries where trade without tariffs is encouraged.
